intro: Beloperone chaetocephala, commonly known as the hairy-headed beloperone, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in a compact cluster. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in coastal or semi-arid regions. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
